titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Bryan, Indictment
CWG5148

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Todd Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky Indictment
against } April Term 1863
John Bryan

the Grand Jury of Todd County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky Accuse John Bryan of the Crime of Felonious breaking into a Storihouse and Stealing Merchandise of the value of therefrom-

Committed as follows ^(viz)^ (Court) the said John Bryan on the 28th day of April 1863 in the County aforesaid did wilfully and feloniousy in the night time break into a storihouse in the possession and Contract of John D Black in which Goods wares and Merchandise was deposited and with the intent to Steal and did Steal and did feloniously take therefrom from Six bottles of whisky the property of the said John D Black and of the value of Six Dollars against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

J G Rouch
foreman Grand Jury
E P Campbell attorney for this Court

Information Given by
Jno D Black
Seth Black
Egbert Garth
J T Buchanan

A copy attest:
Ben Taylor Perkins D. C.
for Ben T Perkins Clerk
